column5: This is so awesome! Happy for you :) + your room is so nice.
All the time. I don‚Äôt understand it.

Yes, this is common. In my experience, the minute anything bad happens I shut down emotionally. The numb feeling lasts for a few days to a month before I have a huge breakdown over something inconsequential.

This post reminds me of an exercise we did while in inpatient care a while ago. They had us draw an ideal intensive care atmosphere. So many of us wished for access to animals, huge green space, music, more personalized treatment, trauma-informed staff, genuine compassion, etc. Instead we got little concrete rooms, insensitive and undertrained staff and playing cards. So heartbreaking how inaccessible adequate care is for victims of CPTSD.

It really breaks my heart as well. I spent most of my earlier years either completely mute or loudly overcompensating. So many of us go unnoticed for so long, our behavior written off as weird kid shit, when it‚Äôs so obviously indicative of deep emotional trauma to someone who‚Äôs looking. Just goes to show just how much we can depend on no one but ourselves to be saved.

I am compelled to agree, but I struggle most with guilt. My mom is a good friend, I care about her and I want to see her happy. In the past she has expressed remorse for the physical abuse. And I want to believe her. I don‚Äôt want to hate my mom as much as I do. I don‚Äôt want to think of her as sadistic. I feel like that‚Äôs a strong word, but even that feeling confuses me. I‚Äòm worried that every thought I have has been construed by her, by my grandfather, by everyone around me. I don‚Äôt know what to do.
Could you define freeze type? I‚Äôm relatively newly diagnosed, & keep hearing that term. I‚Äôd like to learn more about it.

I feel exactly the same way. I only truly feel at peace and in control when I am alone. Trying to understand others is exhausting, trying to communicate true feelings is exhausting. It‚Äôs really a terrible, lonely feeling and I‚Äôm sorry you‚Äôre experiencing. 

Edit: What has helped me is finding peace with the feeling, regardless of what others think. I can exist contentedly on my own, and don‚Äôt need the approval of others.
Same. I thought this was just me.
All the time. The only thing I‚Äôve found that helps is not talking about your issues in depth with anyone but a therapist.
My ex did this to me. So damaging to my self image/esteem.
Didn‚Äôt know this opinion was unpopular. Explains all the bad looks I get.
This. It feels like no matter what I say she will never sympathize. It‚Äôs almost like she is incapable of it.
My parents do this all the time. And it‚Äôs especially difficult because they try to hide it in a veil of empty apologies.
Dope!

The office at my school (called the Success Center) only offers accommodations for people with physical or cognitive disabilities. They don‚Äôt really have anything substantial for students with depression. When asked, they told me to work with my instructors.

I am more stressed than I‚Äôve ever been. Being put out of work, being stuck inside with their trauma/abusers, the change in routine that is stressful to a lot of people. Granted, it‚Äôs different for everyone.

I‚Äôm actually studying to be a journalist (although somewhat unconventionally), i think it would be interesting to talk to someone who‚Äôs in the profession!

My name is Vi, I‚Äôm 17 and I‚Äôm a sociology and journalism student at the end of my second year in uni. I love writing, reading, espresso and indoor gardening. I also love music ‚Äî I was studying to be a cellist until the fall of last year, and I sing all over my hometown.  One of my favorite pastimes during quarantine has been emailing back and forth with a few virtual strangers; it‚Äôs lovely hearing all the stories they have to share. If you‚Äôd like, I can shoot you a message with my email in it!

BPD and PTSD diagnosee here. I‚Äôve found that above all else you should have a realistic support system. One that understands your disorders, is willing to be frank with you, and is able to set clear boundaries. That balance is hard to get at the best of times, and with turbulent relationships being a factor it seems near impossible. I would recommend a a therapist or psychiatrist first, but if you have a great relationship with a family member or two, they could be a great support system. I have found my treatment team to be an immense support outside of social circles. It‚Äôs so refreshing to have them to fall back on when things are difficult. They are also literally professionals in the field, and can set the boundaries necessary for things to remain stable. 

As someone who also struggles with depression, I‚Äôve also found that I do my best when I take things one day at a time. Literally, not thinking about anything beyond the remaining hours you‚Äôre awake. Appreciating the little things. Spending time outside. It sounds cliche but it really helps with some of the worse symptoms of either disorder. 

I wish I had better advice for you, but unfortunately I‚Äôm kind of in a similar position to you. Should you want to, I would be happy to chat with you further. It can help to have people who can sympathize with your symptoms. Regardless I wish you all the best. BPD was a difficult diagnosis for me to receive and honestly all that helped me accept it was time. I hope you keep us updated :).

Edit: spelling

I was diagnosed with CPTSD this past year after only some physical abuse that ultimately hasn‚Äôt impacted my psyche but an entire lifetime of emotional and psychological abuse that has seriously deteriorated my entire sense of self. That shit fucks you up. Im still struggling with the guilt, too, but I try to remember that invalidating my own suffering does not lift the suffering of another. What you went through was traumatizing. Diagnoses don‚Äôt just happen. You are worthy of treatment and recovery. 

I hope this doesn‚Äôt come off as judgmental or inconsiderate. Since our experiences are similar I would be happy to chat with you, if you‚Äôd like.
This happened to me too! My therapist and I had just finished making a plan for me to practice my social skills. Suuper frustrating. Sending you strength, hold onto that determination.

I still do this very often, but I really don‚Äôt know im doing it until long afterward. Naturally, I‚Äôm a bubbly and smiley person, but I switch really quickly and almost subconsciously into my antisocial tendencies. Avoiding eye contact, shutting down conversation, verbal messages that may come off as aggressive. 

Have you conquered this? How do you stay conscious of it?
I agree. Having a set ‚Äúend goal‚Äù is just too much pressure. All that‚Äôs helped me is taking things one day at a time.
Exactly. Sometimes I worry it‚Äôs just my paranoia, but most of the time I end up being right.

I used to overcompensate for the constant rage in my heart and mind. Be super saccharine sweet to everyone I care across. But whenever I perceived abandonment I would get really angry. Say hurtful things. Start to withdraw. And then I get guilty. So recently I‚Äôve vowed to keep to myself until I‚Äôve sorted out my mental illness. Being that overtly friendly took a toll on me. Im emotionally exhausted now. Too tired to become close to anyone, for fear of snapping on them. And my patience is thinner now; I‚Äôm more likely to snap. It‚Äôs very difficult.
Im not sure I‚Äôm understanding you. Do you feel pressure on your eyes? Like they‚Äôre being pushed into your skull, or shrinking? Because that‚Äôs what I experience.

Right! I never thought about this association. Dull people make me so unbelievably angry, I‚Äôd never thought of this as an attribute of my mental illness but my therapist recently brought it to my attention. You‚Äôre not alone.

Thank you for your reply. I really appreciate everything you‚Äôve offered to me. 

My father does not see what my mother did to me as abuse. He enabled it, in some ways. Growing up, both of my parents would hit me and my sisters,  but my mother was a manipulator as well. My father just doesn‚Äôt see it at all, and refuses to acknowledge the destructive nature of her comments. He just tells me to brush it off. He has convinced my sister of the same. My sister‚Äôs feelings toward my mother for the abuse have manifested in aggression and anger, instead of depression and dissociation (as in my case). She has also been sort of brainwashed by my mother into believing that I am just dramatic and over emotional, and that it has nothing to do with my mother. 

I have started the X effect calendar, counting down to May 19, the end of my semester in school. School has been a major added stressor for me. Although it‚Äôs only been a brief time, I have felt some relief being able to focus on one date in the future and seeing that it gets closer as time goes on. Thank you for the suggestion.

Edit: spelling

Thank you for your comment. It is helpful to hear from someone who both has had a similar experience with family trauma and is also studying to be an expert in mental health. I hope you have been well. 

My parents don‚Äôt directly pressure me into telling them about therapy. They just make backhanded comments about me being ‚Äúsecretive‚Äù or lying to them. Sometimes my mother brings out her insecurities on me ‚Äî when I tell her ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather keep that between me and my therapist,‚Äù she‚Äôa been known to say something like ‚ÄúOh right, I forgot, you can‚Äôt trust me because I‚Äôm just an abuser. Sorry!‚Äù and veil it as a joke. She knows I already feel immense guilt for the negative feelings im having toward her, and uses it as fuel against me. My father just gets mopey. And I know he‚Äôs not trying to hurt me, but it really bothers him that I don‚Äôt feel comfortable telling him things and I hate hurting him. Usually I can rationalize that these are manipulation tactics and think my way through them, but I really just don‚Äôt have the energy to risk hearing these things right now. Im worried that I will spiral.
Yes. You aren‚Äôt alone in this at all.
I get nauseous. I start to shake and I feel it in all of my joints. Like my lungs are swelling outward and straining my ribcage. It stings my eyelids.

Ive been working as a barista for a year in the US. I recently started at a new place which pays 13.50 USD/hr excluding benefits. That rate at 30-40 hours per week puts me around 2,100 USD on a good month.
I‚Äôm in the same position. All I can say is I‚Äôm trying to take it one day at a time. I urge you to do the same. Peace and love.

Thanks for responding! This is pretty cohesive, idek where to start. 

 I take meds for my depression and psychosis but they don‚Äôt really do much. I‚Äôm trying to figure this out with my psychiatrist but weve been trying for years so I‚Äôm tempted to just stop them altogether. It‚Äôs a pointless expense at this point. 

I feel like people don‚Äôt like me because I have some serious RBF, only instead of looking like a bitch I just look angry or really sad. I‚Äôm lethargic and have trouble keeping my energy up while hanging out with people for long periods of time. It‚Äôs something I‚Äôm working on. I‚Äôm socially awkward at first, so first impressions with me are never great.

I‚Äôd say that I‚Äôm generally pretty interesting. If I had to describe my look it‚Äôd be like pretentious blipster or something. I‚Äôm not very concerned with the superficial stuff of image. I just don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm very bland. I work as a barista and I love it, especially the talking to customers thing. I find that the depressed feeling comes when I‚Äôm not really doing anything or when I see people my age enjoying themselves while I‚Äôm busting my ass to get by. 

I‚Äôm hoping to adopt a cat once my finances are more in order & I can better take care of a living animal, but for now I spend a lot of time walking my neighbors dogs for them and parent a few houseplants. 

I use dating sites but the issue of age always comes up at some point. I am at the age of consent in New York but it‚Äôs not likely that the people I interact with would feel comfortable meeting up with me off of Tinder or something. I‚Äôm also a lesbian so finding other out WLW in my age group is borderline impossible; everyone is either in the closeted or trying to get a funny story to tell their friends.

Thank you for responding, I really appreciate it. I went to therapy twice a week when I was under my parents‚Äô insurance, but until I can afford it independently it‚Äôs not really an option. I‚Äôm hoping to figure something out with my school‚Äôs counseling center.
She noticed a doodle I‚Äôd left lying around the floor at work and liked the style it was in.

I experience immense fear, to the point where I can‚Äôt speak and only whine and moan until someone holds me and talks me down. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs age regression but I‚Äôve thought about it as a possibility.
Congratulations! Seeing these stories give me hope every day, thanks for sharing.

That‚Äôs the unfortunate reality of the mental health care industry; many ‚Äúexperts‚Äù have unrealistic and immoral views of what mental illness is & that makes it hard for us to get the help we need. There is always hope though. If you feel that one specialist isn‚Äôt a good fit for you, look for another. All flawed institutions have at least a few good eggs.

I‚Äôve been stuck in this for years. I used to be open & honest but we‚Äôve tried everything under the sun to help me get better but nothing works. I figure it‚Äôs just easier to say I‚Äôm okay and go through the motions than go through another med change or be institutionalized again. I am trying to get out of this pattern of thinking, but it‚Äôs hard work & as such I can totally see the difficulties of your situation. 

I guess what I try to keep in mind is that your team exists to help you with your treatment. As such you can begin to think yourself past any guilt you might feel in asking for ‚Äúmore‚Äù help. No request you make should be seen as a burden by any of them, because everything they offer you (insofar as your recovery) should be in your best interest exclusively.

Edit: clarifications
Loneliness is so terribly disorienting. It‚Äôs painful as hell and I wouldn‚Äôt wish it upon anyone. I really hope you continue to go on & that good things come to you.

I agree with you! This mentality is rampant & makes it difficult for us POC to be taken seriously when it counts. Not only that but it feeds white guilt, which is unproductive and harmful to everyone.

The worst part is I have hobbies. I see a therapist, I go to school, i distract myself as much as I can, but to no avail. And it‚Äôs not even exclusive to dating. In fact I have started to avoid relationships for this very reason.

I guess I should have mentioned that this is a volunteer publication being done through the capital pride center and my efforts are not being compensated either. No one is being forced to do anything, and I put out announcements with full information so that the involvement is entirely at the artist discretion.  I‚Äôm doing my job insofar as acting as the pride center‚Äôs editor. Let me reiterate that I already feel really bad about not offering pay.
For what it's worth: I am a girl on the internet and hardly ever get responses.

My main abuser is my mother. All of my life she refused to let me get help. And I always felt it was my fault. I didn‚Äôt know why I was afraid of her, and as such I could never exactly approach her and tell her why I was feeling what I was feeling. I was diagnosed with PTSD two years ago and through therapy learned that my mother was the main source of my symptoms. Having doctors  and therapists approach her with this news was understandably terrible for our relationship and things got worse. She could not accept that her daughter had mental illnesses at all let alone that she had caused them. 

Essentially I don‚Äôt tell her anything. She wouldn‚Äôt believe me even if I tried, and I have. It‚Äôs terrible to have your symptoms denied. Makes you doubt yourself even more than you already do.

I get the same way. I especially get depressed right before I go to sleep, because I know that once I fall asleep I‚Äôm going to have a few hours of peace and waking up will be hell all over again. Doing this every day is horrible.
hey! i would love to exchange letters with you :) pm me if youd like.
what skills r u talking ab?

i try not to bring up my age unless it‚Äôs asked of me but i wouldn‚Äôt be comfortable lying about it. i just think it‚Äôs weird that people won‚Äôt even talk to me in a school setting over something like legal protections, idk if that‚Äôs the only reason

ty for responding:) this has generally been my approach, (only 15 credit hrs/semester tho, i have my limits) but throwing myswlf into school and work has caused some major breakdowns in the past. education has been a high priority all of my life, and this in some ways is the problem. i love school but throwing myself into it and focusing entirely on my future career feels inauthentic. plus in my personal experience it has been an unhealthy coping tool. ion wanna burn out before i turn 18! 

needless to say i respect the hell out of u. i appreciate the advice and will try going forward to just keep my thoughts on my future. I wish u all the best in ur studies!!

My game was mod free at the time of testing a couple days ago. I deleted my library entirely & made just one new household back then to check everything on, at this point im just playing and trying to ignore the tomfoolery occurring in my game. as u can see the ignoring part hasn‚Äôt gone very well lol 

I briefly scanned the forums a week or so ago but should really take some time to keep searching.
trying a factory reset rn
Didn‚Äôt work ü§ß
I go to Troy Kitchen open mics almost every week! Ive heard of Bard & Baker but haven‚Äôt found anyone who‚Äôs wanted to check it out w me:(
maybe get a better doctor
I always recommend green tea unsweetened, but then again the Karens who order like this end up getting something loaded with sugar lol
Some woman orders a tall iced matcha latte in a venti cup with the regular tall amount of milk and water to the top of the cup. She really thinks she‚Äôs doing something lol.

A regular of ours orders a regular caramel frap with 20 shots and extra frap chips, we always have to put it in 2-3 cups. I‚Äôve considered asking the manager if we can charge for more than one drink, but she seems to be fine with letting him get away with it. The folly of the mobile order system ://
i work 5 days a week for 4-6 hours bc i have no regard 4 my well being, but my situation is kinda unique. most teen partners ik work weekends
